poem:
Time's Illusion

Through lens and shadow,
Sugimoto conjures dreams,
still waters ripple,
machines of the mind,
he rewrites hours—
a magician
capturing ghosts,
echoes refract,
into the abyss.

Silent, he whispers:
"Truth is a dance,
fictions play,
in light's embrace,
and my world turns,
beyond time's trace."
